method.step: Wash the potatos. Put them in pressure cooker pan. Add 1 cup of water. Add 0.5 tsp salt. Cook them into pressure cooker for 20 min (or for 3 whistles)
When the cooker cools down, remove the potatos and keep them aside.
Heat the oil in frying pan. Add Mustard seeds. When Mustard seeds crackle add Asafoetida.
Add green chilli paste, ginger paste, bay leaves, cloves powder, cinnamon Powder, cashew nuts paste and poppy seeds. Heat it for about half a minute. Make sure you stir it at regular intervals
Add tomato puree and heat it for about 5-7 min on a medium flame.
Add the potatos, salt and turmeric powder. Stir it and let it simmer for about 5 min.
Garnish it with chopped coriander and the Dum Aloo are ready to serve. (Can serve to about 3 people. Can be consumed with paratha or Jeera Rice.)
